main event: One luminous long white streak was observed going from horizon to horizon in Muncie, Indiana on November 6, 1957. The U.S. Air Force concluded that the flight path indicated it was probably a meteor.
interesting points: The observation included ground-radar, air-visual, and air-intercept radar data.
The duration of the sighting was unknown.
The object was described as a luminous long white streak.
The U.S. Air Force considered the path of the object and concluded it was likely a meteor.
The witness was flying over Muncie, Indiana at the time of the observation.
